intro: Phaca nutans, commonly known as the nodding phaca, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its drooping, yellowish-orange flower heads that bloom in late summer. Phaca nutans is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
